description.narrative: The Project will focus on identifying and elevating new local solutions, following three key pillars: solutions mapping, experimentation and collective intelligence.

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

condition.narrative: UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative: 1.Level of completing a learning cycle on each selected challenge every six months 2.Availability of mapping the local ecosystem for each selected challenge/issue 3.Level of developing an experiment for each selected challenge/issue

comment.narrative: 1. Lack of necessary capacity to complete a learning cycle on each selected challenge every six months 2. Angola does not have mapping the local ecosystem for each selected challenge/issue 3. Lack of necessary capacity to develop an experiment for each selected challenge/issue

- Establish a partnership with a Government Partner - Establish partnerships with private sector partners and start-ups - Activate the local Innovation Ecosystem - Run Solutions Mapping in at least 2 provinces - Promote experiments - Support CO in Innovation and digital tools, platforms and systems - 5 new data sources - 6 different types of data - 35 new potential solutions - 5 new innovation methods - at least 6 Blogs - at least 50% of the challenges have a public sector partner - at least 1 government entity as learned about the AccLab methods - At least 50% of our learning challenges are providing actionable knowledge to ongoing CO projects. - The lab interacts at least once a week with another lab in the network. 48 interaction per year - 25% of information shared across the network should be methodology, or sustainable development issue and opportunity related. - The Accelerator Lab Networks work is featured at least 3 times per month in Country Office Social Media channels and tag UNDP Accelerator Labs accounts. - The Accelerator Lab Networks work is featured at least 3 times per month in Country Office Social Media channels and tag UNDP Accelerator Labs accounts. - The Lab team engages at least once a month across any social media conversation related to the work of the Accelerator Lab Network, from either personal or CO account. - Connect the Accelerator Lab’s publications to local development ecosystem through social media. - Identify and engage with 5 new relevant local social media profiles of the broader Development Ecosystem.

- MOU signed with ANR and MOU signed with MESCTI - MOU /LOA with private sector companies or connecting them to other CO projects - Innovation ecosystem workshop and mapping, meetings with all key actors - Solutions mapping reports and capture cards from at least 2 provinces - Developed. Experiment Concept Notes and Reports - Supported the introduction of innovation tools in other Units CO projects - 5 new data sources - 6 different types of data: Big & Raw data (Structured, unstructured, semi-structured data), Citizen data (citizen-generated data e.g. perception surveys, feedback mechanisms etc.), Open data (freely available data sets), news reporting data - 35 new potential solutions mapped - 5 new innovation methods used: Solutions Mapping, Pilots, Visual Thinking & Mapping, Sensemaking, Collective Intelligence, System Thinking, Data Visualisation - 11 Blogs published in the CO Website - 2 challenges have a public sector partner - ANR and MESCTI - at least 1 government entity has learned about the AccLab methods - At least 50% of our learning challenges are providing actionable knowledge to ongoing CO projects, including Inclusive Growth and Governance projects - informality. - The lab interacts at least once a week with another lab in the network, using teams or WhatsApp, sharing information on methodology, or sustainable development issues or opportunities. - The Accelerator Lab Networks work is featured regularly in Country Office Social Media channels and tag UNDP Accelerator Labs accounts. - Connected the Accelerator Lab’s publications to local development ecosystem through social media and WhatsApp groups. - Identified and engaged with new relevant local social media profiles of the broader Development Ecosystem.

- 10 new data sources per year - 9 different type of data sources per year - 50 new potential solutions per lab per year - 10 innovation methods per Action Plan. - At least 8 blogs, or other (substantial) media posts published per year. - At least 50% of our learning challenges have the public sector or other partner as counterpart. - At least one government entity or partner has adopted an accelerator lab method. - At least 50% of our learning challenges are providing actionable knowledge to ongoing CO projects. - The lab interacts at least once a week with another lab in the network. - 48 interaction per year - 50% of information shared across the network should be methodology, or sustainable development issue and opportunity related. - The Accelerator Lab Network’s work is featured at least 3 times per month in Country Office Social Media channels and tag UNDP Accelerator Labs accounts. - The Lab team engages at least once a month across any social media conversation related to the work of the Accelerator Lab Network, from either personal or CO account. - Connect the Accelerator Lab’s publications to local development ecosystem through social media. - Identify and engage with 10 new relevant local social media profiles of the broader Development Ecosystem.

- Mobilized 200.000USD for a Portfolio Approach on Future of Work via the Innovation Facility. - Helped develop new proposals to mobilize resources and new areas of work for the CO (i.e covid-19 response, reconversion of the informal economy, work and employment) and connecting unusual partners to other CO projects. - Solutions mapping reports and capture cards from at least 4 provinces (Luanda, Benguela, Huíla, Cabinda) - Developed 1 Portfolio of Experiments for Urban Markets and starting to develop a CO Portfolio on the Future of Work. - Supported the introduction of innovation tools in other Units CO projects. - 6 different types of data: Big & Raw data (Structured, unstructured, semi-structured data), Citizen data (citizen-generated data e.g. perception surveys, feedback mechanisms etc.), Open data (freely available data sets), news reporting data. - 26 new potential solutions mapped. - 11 new innovation methods used: Solutions Mapping, Pilots, Visual Thinking & Mapping, Sensemaking, Collective Intelligence, System Thinking, Data Visualisation, micro narratives, Portfolio design, horizon scanning, Hackathon - 3 Blogs published in the CO Website. - All challenges have a public sector partner - MAT/MEP and MESCTI - All learning challenges are providing actionable knowledge to ongoing CO projects, including Inclusive Growth and Governance projects - informality and work. - Portfolio on FOW is bringing new capacities to all CO units. - The lab interacts at least once a month with another African Portuguese speaking Lab in the network through a monthly call, interaction with other labs using teams or WhatsApp, sharing information on methodology, or sustainable development issues or opportunities. Developed the PALOP Hackathon e-voluir with 3 other AccLabs (Guinea Bissau, Cape Verde and Mozambique, and the São Tomé CO). - The Accelerator Lab work is featured regularly in CO Social Media channels. - Connected the Accelerator Lab’s publications to local development ecosystem through social media and WhatsApp groups.

- Sense-making exercise to CO Projects, understand weaknesses, strengths and entry-points adopted and implementation started - Lab is launched to the public and key-stakeholders - The Team was recruited and participated in the Bootcamp - Map the local waste management ecosystem started - Local innovation ecosystem key actors identified - Explore Frontier issues to work on in the following year - 2 new data sources - 3 different types of data - 10 new potential solutions - 2 new innovation methods - 2 Blogs - at least 50% of the challenges have a public sector partner - at least 1 government entity as learned about the AccLab methods - At least 50% of our learning challenges are providing actionable knowledge to ongoing CO projects. - The lab interacts at least once a week with another lab in the network. 48 interaction per year - 5% of information shared across the network should be methodology, or sustainable development issue and opportunity related. - support the Comms Unit strengthening of CO social media presence and interaction

- Sense-making provisional report and results presented to CO during CPD Roll-out - Accelerator Lab launched with the presence of key-stakeholders and media coverage - Recruitment concluded and the team participated in Quito Bootcamp - Local waste ecosystem mapped and meetings with key-stakeholders held - Local innovation ecosystem mapped - Potential / Provisional Frontier Issues to work in 2020 selected - 3 new data sources used - 3 different types of data: citizen data, open data, structured and unstructured data - 10 new potential solutions mapped on waste management - 3 new innovation methods: solutions mapping, sense making, visual thinking and mapping - 2 Blogs were published in CO Website - negotiated potential partnership with ANR - at least 5 government partners learned about or participated in sensemaking - waste management data provided actionable knowledge to ongoing CO projects. - The lab interacted frequently with another lab in the network, using Teams and WhatsApp, sharing information about methodology, or sustainable development issues or opportunities. - supported the strengthening of CO social media presence and interaction to allow for the AccLab to share regular posts on twitter or facebook.

- 7 different types of data sources used - 25 new potential solutions mapped - 8 innovation methods used per challenge - At least 8 blogs, or other (substantial) media posts published. - At least 50% of our learning challenges have the public sector or other partner as counterpart. - At least 50% of our learning challenges are providing actionable knowledge to ongoing CO projects. - The lab interacts at least once a month with another lab in the network and participates in the regular network weekly calls. - The Accelerator Lab Network’s work is featured regularly in the CO social media channels - Connect the Accelerator Lab’s publications to local development ecosystem through social media.
